title: "Azir is no skill and auto wins lane"
body: What I just heard from a salty ass plat  1 talon ... wut

replies.body: I get it. Talon...because birds have talons, and owls are birds.
And Azir is a bird *mind blown*

azir to me
squawk :V
http://40.media.tumblr.com/0d4c422d4f2035d3bb56de45ce63026e/tumblr_nb0r9dbK3k1tw60hoo1_1280.jpg
Won't find me downvoting Azir fanart :D
Azir and Anavia are my favorite bird champions. Valor is my second favorite.
They're also kind of the only bird champions. Unless you count Swain's ult as well, but that's literally it.
{{champion:77}} *ahem
dont forget {{champion:9}} !
{{champion:3}} maybe even him
nah, then you'd have to count {{champion:266}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:25}} as well.
what about ravenborn{{champion:7}}
{{champion:133}}
Only with his Primal Udyr skin though. And maybe Spirit Guard a little. But even then he's only like that a fourth of the time.
{{champion:34}} {{champion:268}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:133}} {{champion:77}}  and i think {{champion:22}}  has that vison ability as a bird, and {{champion:40}}  ''W'' i think is a bird
I love it :D.
What is with people and saying Azir is easy? Have they ever played him?
Low skill floor if they are against a melee. Place soldier, harass, q harass. But he has an insane skill cap though, and it a ton harder to play against a ranged

Any time a person sees a lane bully they automatically assume they must be easy, because they're strong during one of the most annoying times for an enemy to be strong. It's a mental bias. Everyone does it. 

Everyone.
(Sensing salty riven main.)
(Implying Riven is only strong during a certain time instead of the entire time...)

... I don't even play Riven.

Pointing out a bias that everyone does has nothing to do with Riven.
Agreed. Azir is, in my opinion, the hardest champion to play in the game. But if you can play him well (which I can't) it can be really good. I love the ult, just cant work with the rest of the kit
{{champion:432}} Would like a word with you.
Bard? more like hard... to play as.

Old Azir was a bitch.

New Azir is a pansy.  These kids have it easy.

#Azirlanebullysurvivor

Not going to lie Azir is extremely sophisticated, both mechanically and strategically. 

However, pre-nerf someone who was very good with Azir pretty much did automatically win lane, because the nature of Azir's kit meant it was near impossible to beat him in lane if he knew what he was doing, regardless of how good you are on your champion.
Assuming your myriad of bugs didn't screw you over, I more or less agree though. Thing is this was just now and with him being an assassin something Azir is generally considered weak against.
Talon has all the tools to work around Azir's kit in an all-in, too. You just gotta survive da pokes.
You'd think but i'm just a "trash low silver player who plays noob champs" what do I know

{{champion:268}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:60}} {{champion:412}}  and {{champion:64}}  are mechanically  the hardest champions to master in game hands down. Whoever says that either of those is a noob champion, needs a serious medical threatment.
No Bard?

I agree with all of them except Thresh. 

He isn't THAT hard to play, and anyone who plays about 4 or 5 games with him can do decently with him. Yes, he isn't someone you can pick up right off the bat, but compared to the others you have listed, which take considerable practice and time to even play efficiently, he is FAR easier.
I feel like {{champion:61}} needs a mention there

Possibly Riven as well. Yeah, she gets a lot of crap, and people can just spam abilities on her and do OK. 

But the way you separate the OK Riven players from the great Riven players is the mastery of her animation canceling, which definitely takes time and practice. Learning the different combos and using them efficiently also takes time.
People will say anything when they lose.

azir is one of if not the hardest champ in this game he has to micromanage everything. Additionally early on azir laning is weak like really weak and is item dependent and will punish any mistakes. He is beyond far to win lane easily any good talon player would immediatly burst azir down if they know what there doing and if azir is out of position. AND there another positioning its so dang important playing when playing azir because its like playing vayne. weak early but very strong late but gets shit on if  poorly positioned. :D OK

I wish people would just realize that when someone says a champion takes no skill, it is because they are so desperate that they would say anything to get the last word in. Talon is a lot more simple than Azir in my opinion. I feel your pain OP.
Kind of bummed people didn't jump on my Riv bashing, maybe it's just me that thinks all he does is spout nonsense.
He's the play by play guy, his job is to fill dead air when there isn't much to say. Another common Rivingtonism is "They are getting everything they want."

> [{quoted}](name=Nevaxas,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=hiv6O19Y,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2015-05-23T02:41:14.445+0000)
>
> Kind of bummed people didn't jump on my Riv bashing, maybe it's just me that thinks all he does is spout nonsense.

Spouts nonsense indeed

Cause all he can do is repeat exactly what was just said, and end with "indeed". That is literally how he starts every single sentence. 

"That was a crazy fight." "Crazy fight indeed, Jatt"

Seriously, go look at every game from this season (at least), and every time he starts to talk, all he does is just repeat the last thing that was said, then says indeed. 

Drives me crazy.
:D my soulmate!

> [{quoted}](name=Nevaxas,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=hiv6O19Y,comment-id=000d00000000,timestamp=2015-05-23T03:15:42.499+0000)

> :D my soulmate!

My soulmate, indeed, Nevaxas. This is one _chaotic_, league thread.

Azir's my main mage, and I'll say, past LB talon is his worst nightmare.
lol wut
